text: I don't want to imagine I have a portal with 100 pages using the same template and if I change an element on the template I have to rewrite again the text on all those 100 live pages. Not only all the work it means but the client annoyance having all those pages with lorem ipsum until we fix them
So if you revert back to prior to your changes you should be able to get it back (if you don't resave the pages on the page level) as the module id's still contain the data
if you're making changes to the templates you should keep the module the same (without replacing it) and move it to where you want.
<@U2Q5LPHGS> <@U25C65C3S> is correct. Use the revision tool in HubSpot in that template and go back to your change. everything will be back to the way it was before you made your change.

<@U25C65C3S> <@U38EZFVFE> Thanks both! In this case the change was in a cta and nothing to do with the rich text module where is the text that was changed in saving the template. Is this an expected behaviour?
because if everytime we do the change have this problem how can we avoid it but make the change finally?

I think you might want to reach out to HS support and tell them which revision(time of change) was the one that caused the issue, give them the pages that were affected (not all, just one or two for example) <@U2Q5LPHGS> — they will be able to really help nail this down
and then please report back on your findings!
Thanks <@U25PYL3Q8>, so you agree is not an expected behaviour?

I don’t believe so. Generally when you change a module it will update teh default values, not ones that are already live. I have to delete a module and re add after I’ve updated it, so that I can get the new default values.
Thanks Nick! I thought so but wanted to be sure I wasn't missing something, and last thing, who would you report it in HubSpot?
I just click the support button in the bottom right. and use the support inbox
ok!
Thanks for all the help :wink:
Anyone get a weird Cloudflare notice when trying to load a HubSpot blog or web page?
nope, not here <@U25C6PU56>
Thanks so much <@U6AEA3EV6> :slightly_smiling_face:
anyone knows if is posible to send a RSS email with “the most readed blog post” of the year, for example, or something like that?
You could send a manual email with your top rated blog post

second question, is there a way to use different “password page templates” on a site? now we can olny use a single one. im working on a site with multiple password protected pages for diferent clients and we want to personalize the password page for they.
thats what we are doing but i have to ask :slightly_smiling_face:
I don't think you can at the template level. But you can always add page specific styles
